DOC.brief_summary: Whole blood from pregnant women will be collected to develop a noninvasive fetal sex test.
DOC.brief_title: Development of a Fetal Sex Assay From Maternal Whole Blood
DOC.detailed_description: This is an observational study whereby samples will be tested to determine the presence or absence of fetal Y chromosome genes to test for the fetal sex of the baby. The blood draw will occur between 6 to 16 weeks of gestation. The fetal gender will be requested at or soon after delivery if fetal sex was not previously obtained by CVS or amniocentesis genetic analysis.
DOC.criteria: Subject is 1864 years of age Subject is female Subject is pregnant and between 6 and 16 weeks of gestation Subject provides a signed and dated informed consent If subject undergoes a routine ultrasound between weeks 16 and 28, she agrees to provide the fetal sex results If subject undergoes an invasive procedure, she agrees to provide the fetal sex results
